name: longsighted
content:
longsighted adjective
(JUDGMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
(also far-sighted) having good judgment about what will happen in the future and the ability to make wise decisions based on this: His foreign policy was a combination of longsighted achievements and short-sighted blunders. They showed themselves to be broad-minded, mature, and long-sighted. Opposite
nearsightedRelated word
longsightedness
More examplesFewer examplesYou need to be longsighted when it comes to calling the bottom of bear markets. Where would English literature be today, were it not for some long-sighted publishers seeing the potential of these writers?

longsighted adjective
(EYES)
mainly UK (US usually far-sighted) A longsighted person can only clearly see objects that are far away: Convex lenses help those who are longsighted; concave lenses those who are short-sighted. Long-sighted people are unable to see close objects clearly. Opposite
nearsightedRelated word
longsightedness
